ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 230
ygData.msgSnippet: yes I think you ve got it ... From: Rala AmaranthineFuhrer  To:  Sent: Wednesday, February 16, 2000 8:32 PM
ygData.messageBody:
yes I think you've got it

----- Original Message -----
From: Rala AmaranthineFuhrer <rala_eq@...>
To: <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, February 16, 2000 8:32 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] Digest Number 230


> From: Rala AmaranthineFuhrer <rala_eq@...>
>
> ok the jewlery bag has 4 slots but when making jewlery
> all you need is one gem one metal so add one gem
> cutter one grease all 4 slots used????
>
> Rala
>
> ->
> > Message: 3
> > Date: Wed, 16 Feb 2000 02:46:22 -0500
> > From: "Russ Gresh"
> > <lordgrunk@...>
> > Subject: Re: gem cutter idea.
> >
> >
> > > From: "Jeremy Wells" <jjdlc@...>
> > >
> > > Currently I am still too low lvl and too poor to
> > try these ideas, but
> > wanted
> > > to present them to the tinkering community for
> > appraisal. Here is my idea
> > > of what might work.
> > >
> > > A jeweler combines in his bag.
> > >
> > > 1 pearl or black pearl (this might be used on
> > other gems, but this seems
> > the
> > > best place to start considering it is stated in
> > the journal)
> > > + all other components need to create any given
> > jewelry piece. (might
> > start
> > > off with a ring, as that seems a good place for an
> > anaglyph)
> > > 1 gemcutter
> > > 1 grease
> > >
> > > This is my base test idea, I have other thoughts
> > for components, for
> > example
> > > runes, spells, etc. for a pattern for the
> > anaglyph. If anyone has any
> > other
> > > ideas, please post them, as I am interested in
> > reading all thoughts on the
> > > subject. And if anyone who is rich enough and
> > brave enough to try my
> > idea,
> > > please let me know.
> > >
> > > Felburne
> > > Gnome of the 18th season.
> >
> > keep in mind that the jewelry bag only has 4 slots
> >
> > Fixer
> >
> >
> >
> >
>
